intro: Cistanche calotropidis, commonly known as the desert dodder, is a parasitic plant that lacks chlorophyll and relies on host plants for nutrients. It belongs to the Orobanchaceae family and is native to arid and semi-arid regions of Asia. The plant produces yellow or orange flowers and has a fibrous, branching structure. It is often found growing on the roots of various shrubs and trees. Due to its unique adaptations, it plays a role in ecological systems where it coexists with its host species.
